modules.description: Handles cache file and directory paths according to the XDG base directory specification. Provides `user_dir` to retrieve the user-specific cache directory and `user_file` to construct cache file paths within that directory. Works with custom environment configurations and checks file existence when needed. Useful for applications needing to store temporary or cached data in standard XDG locations without directly manipulating paths.

This module determines data file and directory locations according to the XDG base directory specification. It provides functions to retrieve user-specific and system-wide data directories and files, with optional existence checks and environment overrides. Use it to locate configuration files, cache directories, or application-specific data in a standardized way across different systems.

This module handles configuration file and directory paths according to the XDG base directory specification. It provides functions to retrieve user-specific and system-wide configuration directories and files, with support for environment overrides and existence checks. Use it to locate configuration files in standard XDG-compliant paths, such as finding a user's config file in `~/.config` or system-wide configs in `/etc/xdg`.

Implements the XDG Base Directory specification for locating and managing configuration, data, and cache files. Provides functions to retrieve user-specific and system-wide directories and files, create parent directories when opening files, and handle environment overrides. Useful for finding configuration files in `~/.config`, storing application data in `~/.local/share`, or managing cache files in `~/.cache`.
